verses.verse: Woe <S%H480><s%> is me! for I am as when they have gathered <S%H622><s%> the summer <S%H7019><s%> fruits, as the grape gleanings <S%H5955><s%> of the vintage: <S%H1210><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> cluster <S%H811><s%> to eat: <S%H398><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> desired <S%H183><s%> the first ripe <S%H1063><s%> fruit.

The good <S%H2623><s%> man is perished <S%H6><s%> out of the earth: <S%H776><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> upright <S%H3477><s%> among men: <S%H120><s%> they all <S%H3605><s%> lie in wait <S%H693><s%> for blood; <S%H1818><s%> they hunt <S%H6679><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%> with a net. <S%H2764><s%>

That they may do evil <S%H7451><s%> with both hands <S%H3709><s%> earnestly, <S%H3190><s%> the prince <S%H8269><s%> asks, <S%H7592><s%> and the judge <S%H8199><s%> asks <S%H7592><s%> for a reward; <S%H7966><s%> and the great <S%H1419><s%> man, he utters <S%H1696><s%> his mischievous <S%H1942><s%> desire: <S%H5315><s%> so they wrap <S%H5686><s%> it up.

The best <S%H2896><s%> of them is as a brier: <S%H2312><s%> the most upright <S%H3477><s%> is sharper than a thorn <S%H4534><s%> hedge: <S%H4534><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of your watchmen <S%H6822><s%> and your visitation <S%H6486><s%> comes; <S%H935><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> shall be their perplexity. <S%H3998><s%>

Trust <S%H539><s%> you not in a friend, <S%H7453><s%> put you not confidence <S%H982><s%> in a guide: <S%H441><s%> keep <S%H8104><s%> the doors <S%H6607><s%> of your mouth <S%H6310><s%> from her that lies <S%H7901><s%> in your bosom. <S%H2436><s%>

For the son <S%H1121><s%> dishonors <S%H5034><s%> the father, <S%H2><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> rises <S%H6965><s%> up against her mother, <S%H517><s%> the daughter <S%H3618><s%> in law <S%H3618><s%> against her mother <S%H2545><s%> in law; <S%H2545><s%> a man's <S%H376><s%> enemies <S%H341><s%> are the men <S%H582><s%> of his own house. <S%H1004><s%>
Therefore I will look <S%H6822><s%> to the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> I will wait <S%H3176><s%> for the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation: <S%H3468><s%> my God <S%H430><s%> will hear <S%H8085><s%> me.

Rejoice <S%H8056><s%> not against me, O my enemy: <S%H341><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I fall, <S%H5307><s%> I shall arise; <S%H6965><s%> when I sit <S%H3427><s%> in darkness, <S%H2822><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall be a light <S%H216><s%> to me.

I will bear <S%H5375><s%> the indignation <S%H2197><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> I have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him, until <S%H5704><s%> he plead <S%H7378><s%> my cause, <S%H7379><s%> and execute <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> for me: he will bring <S%H3318><s%> me forth <S%H3318><s%> to the light, <S%H216><s%> and I shall behold <S%H7200><s%> his righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

Then she that is my enemy <S%H341><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> it, and shame <S%H955><s%> shall cover <S%H3680><s%> her which said <S%H559><s%> to me, Where <S%H346><s%> is the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God? <S%H430><s%> my eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> her: now <S%H6258><s%> shall she be trodden <S%H4823><s%> down as the mire <S%H2916><s%> of the streets. <S%H2351><s%>
In the day <S%H3117><s%> that your walls <S%H1447><s%> are to be built, <S%H1129><s%> in that day <S%H3117><s%> shall the decree <S%H2706><s%> be far <S%H7368><s%> removed.

In that day <S%H3117><s%> also he shall come <S%H935><s%> even to you from Assyria, <S%H804><s%> and from the fortified <S%H4692><s%> cities, <S%H5892><s%> and from the fortress <S%H4693><s%> even to the river, <S%H5104><s%> and from sea <S%H3220><s%> to sea, <S%H3220><s%> and from mountain <S%H2022><s%> to mountain. <S%H2022><s%>
Notwithstanding the land <S%H776><s%> shall be desolate <S%H8077><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> of them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein, for the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of their doings. <S%H4611><s%>

Feed <S%H7462><s%> your people <S%H5971><s%> with your rod, <S%H7626><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> of your heritage, <S%H5159><s%> which dwell <S%H7931><s%> solitarily <S%H910><s%> in the wood, <S%H3293><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of Carmel: <S%H3760><s%> let them feed <S%H7462><s%> in Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Gilead, <S%H1568><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old. <S%H5769><s%>
According to the days <S%H3117><s%> of your coming <S%H3318><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> will I show <S%H7200><s%> to him marvelous <S%H6381><s%> things.

The nations <S%H1471><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> and be confounded <S%H954><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> their might: <S%H1369><s%> they shall lay <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3027><s%> on their mouth, <S%H6310><s%> their ears <S%H241><s%> shall be deaf. <S%H2790><s%>

They shall lick <S%H3897><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> like a serpent, <S%H5175><s%> they shall move <S%H7264><s%> out of their holes <S%H4526><s%> like worms <S%H2119><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> they shall be afraid <S%H6342><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God, <S%H430><s%> and shall fear <S%H3372><s%> because of you.

Who <S%H4310><s%> is a God <S%H410><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> to you, that pardons <S%H5375><s%> iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and passes <S%H5674><s%> by the transgression <S%H6588><s%> of the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of his heritage? <S%H5159><s%> he retains <S%H2388><s%> not his anger <S%H639><s%> for ever, <S%H5703><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he delights <S%H2654><s%> in mercy. <S%H2617><s%>

He will turn <S%H7725><s%> again, <S%H7725><s%> he will have compassion <S%H7355><s%> on us; he will subdue <S%H3533><s%> our iniquities; <S%H5771><s%> and you will cast <S%H7993><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> their sins <S%H2403><s%> into the depths <S%H4688><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%>

You will perform <S%H5414><s%> the truth <S%H571><s%> to Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and the mercy <S%H2617><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you have sworn <S%H7650><s%> to our fathers <S%H1><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%>
